I love Whitneyâ€™s place the most of all my trip (14 days with 5 Airbnb stays)! Chicken Coop is very cool and clean and cozy property with just everything you need for your stay. Plus, Whitney must be an artist because she decorated her place very nice and decorative. Parking is also super convenient with a private parking right in front of the cottage. A big yard with table and chairs for morning coffee and sunset relaxation is a real value.
The location is also great, close to some best sightseeings in Colorado Springs (Garden of the Gods, Manitou Springs) with quite and beautiful neighborhoods.
One more plus is Whitney and her husband are super helpful and responsive. Theyâ€™re quick to fix things when needed and provided lots of useful guides for dining, sightseeings, etc.
I would 100% recommend you all to book this place when visiting Colorado Springs for Iâ€™ll surely book again if we come back. Thanks Whitney for hosting us!

review_text: Brian and Whitneyâ€™s Chicken Coop was an extremely nice and quaint stay. Our first day arriving, we got to meet Brian and he was very nice welcoming us to the Coop as he was finishing up a couple of things! We also had unexpected visitors on the other side of the fence, some deer! Very relaxing and peaceful to sit outside in the mornings on the adirondack chairs with coffee in hand. So many stores and restaurants in the area that are 100% walkable! We did have an issue with the ceiling fan and Keurig being a little dirty but Whitney did send someone at the earliest convenience possible and went above and beyond to make it right! She is great at communicating and gives very fast responses! Only issue I had that isnâ€™t their fault, itâ€™s that I am 6ft tall and I just needed to duck under the restroom doorframe to get in as well as for the shower, but it did not take away from the experience! Highly recommend this stay if available!

It was very clean and smelled fresh. We loved the postcards! The bed is really soft, which my daughter loved, im more of a firm girl but we both slept great! The shower gets good and hot but the water pressure is a little soft, so ladies just go a lite on the condition :) The area outdoors was really nice as well! We were so close to main street where you could eat and shop all day! We even got to see wildlife! The only warning i would give is about the parking, its tight!...if u drive a full size truck or something in comparison, i was able to get into area provided but it was a job, Whitney did offer other parking but wanted truck close and honestly it was the neighbors horse trailer across the street that made it difficult to get in&out of spot. Over all we loved and would definitely stay again!

review_text: When I first got there the place looked great at first sight. As I was scoping the place, I noticed the throw blanket did not smell clean, the stove was stained, & the restroom had an odd smell - enough to have to keep the window open. The restroom seemed fine, until the smell wouldnâ€™t fade, the toilet felt wobbly, & the shower spilled water unless the shower curtain was tucked in, which only made it that much smaller and slippery. There is no curtain on balcony door, which allows others to look straight into the airbnb. The heater did not work. I had so much trouble keeping it on. I even put it on 80F to see if it would turn on & still no luck. It snowed while I stayed there, so this was not appreciated. Having to use a 3rd party to get the check in felt so unnecessary because why, after having to pay so much money, should I have to verify my identity. Other than that, location is GREAT, parking was always available, & lots of nice restaurants around.

name: Chanice
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Although very close to downtown COS and walkable to restaurants, our stay was unpleasant. I was never sent the check-in instructions and had to call customer support once we arrived in COS and be transferred to an associate who was finally able to "check us in". The heater in the house did not work our entire stay. We walked into a very cold house and the heater clicked all night and eventually turned on ONCE but quick working again. The house did not have any extra blankets - only the sheets/comforter on the one bed - so we had to bundle up with extra clothes to stay warm for two nights. The bathroom tub was dirty and full of hair. Pots and pans were dirty with old food. The outlets in the entry way, bathroom, and upstairs bedroom near the bed did not work. The neighbors were incredibly loud and got into a fight around midnight our second night there. They were screaming, slamming internal and external doors, and moving furniture around for multiple hours in the middle of the night.

Exactly like the pictures and reviews even down to the low ceiling you may hit your head or shoulder on. Itâ€™s a cute small place however the window in the door to the balcony needs a curtain as does the window across from the bed. Even though itâ€™s on the second floor you can still see through the unit. Neighborhood is quiet and very close to restaurants. Abandoned house was kinda creepy. The level the bed is on doesnâ€™t cool down well even with the ac on so if youâ€™re a hot sleeper you will definitely notice it, if not there is two fans provided.
The badâ€¦.
Initial checkin was seamless and the unit looked exactly like the pictures however upon inspection of the bathroom, the tub had a balled up towel with pubic hairs and was still wet. There was also mens soap and dirty foot prints and more pubes inside the tub. It clearly wasnt cleaned and someone had just used it. I messaged Hoste around 630pm when we checked in and he apologized for the issue and said he would inform the right people however he offered only the apology and no solutions or compensation. After the dirty tub the integrity of the entire apartment was at question because how is the only tub in this small unit missed ? Once we advised him we were uncomfortable with the tub he advised he would reimburse us for any cleaning supplies we would have gotten to clean his tub. He would have even had the cleaners drop off supplies incase we didnâ€™t want to buy them. I politely asked him to have the cleaners clean the tub then since they were going to drop off the cleaning supplies. He said ok and advised they could come after 330pm. Our stay was only 2night 3 days.

review_text: Beautiful building in a great location; however, we ran into a few issues regarding cleanliness of the unit and a hostile couch that crumbled beneath us when my wife and I sat on it upon arrival. I will say, HOSTE was quick to rectify our troubles and refund us. Of note, the stove eyes were not cleaned and the fans stored in the closet were packed with dust. Understanding it is Colorado, so weather is generally comfortable, the loft remained quite hot as the A/C did not circulate properly in this area of the unit. For this reason, we attempted to make use of the fans provided, but these were packed with dust which coated the loft when we turned them on. The stairs to the loft are also quite narrow, so keep this in mind when booking if you chance to be over 150 lbs. Additionally, there were no blinds on the patio door, so anyone from the street could peer into the main living area (thus privacy was a concern considering the centrality of the unit to downtown). Altogether, the unit is artistically designed, but much work needs to be done for this to be a top-notch stay for any traveller.

The listing claimed "mountain views," but the only way to see the mountains was to be on the patio, and get a tiny glimpse of the top of one in between the trees next door. This is really a super cute place, so it's kind of a shame that it's overall pretty inconvenient. The spiral stairs are a bit frightening in the middle of the night, and if carrying anything at all. Again, really cute place, but needs some definite improvements.

review_text: Great location. Very central. Loved proximity to downtown restaurants and mountain biking in Red Rock, Garden of Gods, Cheyenne Mountain State Park. I was traveling with my son and it suited our needs well. I gave 4/5 for cleanliness because the shower curtain hadn't been washed for a while. It's one of those lovely clawfoot bathtub/showers but they had shower curtains going around the tub on the outside and first time I showered water dripped down and got the whole bathroom floor wet. I pulled the shower curtain into the tub to avoid this but realized it was quite dirty and pulling the shower curtains in, there was a higher likelihood of them touching me. Also, I could deal with not having a dishwasher, but there was no dish rack either. I had to put utensils, bowls, dishes into a plastic bin to drip dry and later did some cloth drying before putting them away. Yes, the upstairs loft can be quite warm when it gets 80+ even with AC on, but once the sun goes down cool circulating air from open windows plus the fan upstairs makes it tolerable. All in all we did enjoy our stay.

review_text: Our suite in the cottage was perfect for 2 people! Although there is no kitchen, the room had provisions of a microwave oven, Keurig coffee pod coffeemaker, paper plates, plastic silverware, napkins, paper towels, tea, coffee pods, snacks, and instant oatmeal. We mostly ate out; however, in the early morning it was nice to have a cup of tea or coffee with a warm danish. The bed was firm and very comfortable and, although we did not need it, it was nice to notice that it was all handicapped accessible. The cottage is located in the heart of the historic North End district and there is a beautiful 1929 Episcopal church just behind the cottage. Everything is within walking distance. Parking is a little tight so do mind Tinaâ€™s directions for parking. We had a great stay and would love to come back again!

Tina's place is a gem. Great central location near Colorado College at the north end of downtown. Restaurant options from burgers and pizza to fine dining within walking distance or a short drive. Central to all of Colorado Springs.
The space between the main house and the Airbnb cottage forms a private parking courtyard. Your car is visible from the room. It feels secure and peaceful.
The room was spotless and showed great attention to details that make for a comfortable stay: wifi, coffee, snacks, coat hangers, luggage stands, comfortable bed, plenty of towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash. Everything was there. Everything worked.
I highly recommend Tina's place and hope to stay there on my next visit.

The bed has one of the most comfortable mattresses I've ever slept on. The location near downtown is just perfect for accessing all parts of CO Springs, and the neighborhood was quiet and felt safe. name: Mike
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
There is not a better place to stay in Colorado Springs with everything you want. The location is a very short walk to downtown located just a block or two from Colorado College in a historic district. The spot is surrounded by other historic homes, churches, and small businesses. You can easily make your way to hip and cool restaurants, shops, and bars in a few minutes. Moreover, you are less than a 30 minute drive to any of the surrounding tourist attractions. It's very centrally located
The visible amenities are amazing. It's lovely space with a large dining room table, a spacious bed, a large bathroom, and lots of antique furniture. The windows come with both translucent blinds and shades to give you both privacy and whatever amount of light you need. Moreover, it feels very open and comfortable. There is also a massive television on the wall if you want to sit back and relax in front of the TV.
What truly takes this location to the next level are the hidden extra features and excellent details. The Internet is very fast and worked wonderfully for the work we needed to accomplish. There are also abundant power outlets and more than enough spots to plug-in all your devices. The room also had dishes, coffee, a microwave, fridge with freezer, snacks, water, and every other little item to make your visit perfect. Returning every evening to our reserved parking spot was a wonderful convenience. I also loved that the doors had a code for entry, making it convenient and simple to leave and return.
The location itself is very serene and quiet. While the front location of the main home is on a very busy street, you actually slip down a back alley to get to the cottage and parking. There are other guest rooms nearby but we never heard them other than a friendly greeting in passing. We never felt crowded or disturbed. The alley itself has no traffic and sits behind a very beautiful church. It's not only quite private, it feels very safe.
Overall, the cottage is really a perfect location with amazing amenities in a beautiful setting. This would absolutely be our first choice if we return to Colorado Springs. It was easy, comfortable, and exactly everything you want when traveling.

name: Kay
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2020
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
This place was lovely! The location was perfect for my stay and the space comfortably accommodated myself and my partner. Tina was super helpful and responsive to my messages.
I have only one criticism that is more of a personal discovery so not something to hold against the hosts. I just thought I would share it as a heads up.
The listing clearly states that the thermostat is shared with the connected unit (duplex) so that the host controls the thermostat. I didn't have any issues with having the temp increased. Tina always responded quickly to my requests. With that said, it could be a bit inconvenient for me at times. For example, if I didn't return until late in the evening I wasn't comfortable messaging on a weekday at 11pm to ask about the thermostat. So I would wait until the next day. (The heating blanket was awesome though!)
If that doesn't bother you, then definitely book this unit! I enjoyed my week-long stay.

review_text:
My husband and I canâ€™t express enough how both our host, Tina, and her Camden Cottage Suite is like a dream!
The cottage is cozy, spotlessly clean, and beautiful in every direction and is reflective of how an amazing and warm person Tina is.
Tina was very understanding, patient, and accommodating to all our questions and requests which was very much appreciated as we got caught in the middle of Hurricane Sally and had to make a few modifications to our travel plans which made all the difference and was helpful in our trip being a success. We give Tina and her family our heartfelt thanks!
Tinaâ€™s level of care and thoughtfulness is apparent throughout the home from the comfortable bedding, a very thorough local information guidebook that she personally made, and ensuring a pleasantly well-stocked cottage with items and many amenities that arenâ€™t typically offered at many BnBs which made our stay absolutely lovely and restful.
Our stay at the Camden Cottage Suite was the highlight of our trip. We felt so welcomed and comfortable. We will definitely book and highly recommend staying at The Camden Cottage Suite when visiting Colorado Springs!

We appreciated the fact that even though we stayed in a bedroom/bathroom suite, there was a lot of space and amenities such as a fully stocked coffee maker, a fridge stocked with water and creamer for coffee, and a microwave. name: Daniel
rating_info:

November 2019
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The unit was larger than a normal hotel room. It was very cute and cozy, decorated with beautiful antique furniture. LOTS of light from numerous windows, all with easy pull blinds. . Host provided a large notebook with thorough instructions for everything from the locks to the TV remotes. Also a TON of info on what to do in Colorado Springs. Even a walking map to downtown. Extras included extra towels, plenty of soaps, shampoos, & lotions, Keurig with an assortment of coffees, a wide variety of teas, a variety of sweeteners & sugar, creamers and waters in the fridge, to go cups & covers, iron & board, even an electric blanket (my wife loved that). Dorm size microwave & fridge/freezer. Wi-fi had good signal. Extra large flat-screen on the wall included Apple TV. Bed was firm but comfortable, as was the bedding & numerous pillows. Location was easy to access, in the alley behind a big house a few blocks N of downtown. Communication was great. EVERY note I sent was returned within an hour. Tina even emailed me to warn me of a parade downtown Saturday and told me which way to get around it. We not only would stay here again, we ARE staying here again in 3 weeks when we are back in Colorado Springs. One more thing to note. There were power strips on both sides of the bed, and by the big dining room table, so plenty of places to charge.

Beautifully furnished, comfortable bed, plenty of wall outlets, mini fridge/freezer, microwave, and Keurig with everything you need. She has Apple TV and a big TV in the room. We had no issues setting up our Netflix and Hulu accounts on it. Tina left an awesome Welcome binder in our room with a ton of great ideas. The cottage is maybe 20 minutes from Manitou Springs and Garden of the Gods and Pikes Peak. Only an hour south of Denver. We had an excellent stay and would definitely stay again if we come back to Colorado Springs! (Side note: she keeps the room at 73 degrees, and provides a small fan and a heating blanket. We like our house cold, but we had no issues! We turned the fan on and sometimes opened the windows and it was perfect ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»)

This is a great place for a couple or maybe 3 but keep in mind the camper is small and cozy. Most nights are cool and you can just open the windows, but there is air-conditioning.
I highly recommend this place if you just want a quiet getaway to reconnect with yourself and nature.

this was a really cute camper van, a bit smaller than expected but is very cozy and has so many furnishings! we were here for a day and were able to explore some parts of the black forest. we were pleasantly surprised by some of the thoughtful touches (s'mores, goat petting, etc!)
the only big problem we had was with the heating. the heating doesn't reach all the way to the bed area even at the highest setting, and it turned off in the middle of the night and it was freezing in the van. during the morning, the bed remained at a medium temperature between the heater and the outdoor temp, which was too cold to hang out. since our heads are right by the windows which don't do much for heat retention, we woke up with a head cold after the evening. we were under all the blankets but it still got super cold, so I would not recommend staying after the night temp drops below freezing!

name: Kay
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Debra and Terryâ€™s property is a gem of a glamping escape just outside of Colorado Springs. It was just the right size for me and my 8 year old granddaughter.
The vintage trailer is so charming and decorated beautifully inside and out.
The well-apportioned kitchen has all the amenities for a quick meal. The fridge is just the right size to hold drinks, eggs or leftovers from a day exploring the town. A small table inside is the perfect size for a dinner for two.
There is a small toilet inside the trailer and a large shared bathroom, with tub and shower, just inside the main house, which is several yards down the path from the trailer.
The bed is very comfortable and the space is sparkling clean.
Debra and Terry provide a portable fire pit for sâ€™mores or enjoying an evening outside under the stars.
The property is huge with lots of space for walks and visits with the resident goats and sheep. There are also a few great hiking trails just up the road.
Exploring Colorado Springs is convenient. The trailer is 30 minutes drive to Manitou Springs, Garden of the Gods, Pikeâ€™s Peak Railroad or Cheyenne Mountain Zoo.
After a day exploring, this cute trailer was a perfect respite in the quiet forest.
I would definitely stay here again.

Note that the trailer is situated right next to the homeowners house and garage, so that there is no private outdoor area anywhere around the trailer. Inside the trailer is cute and the bed is comfy. Hopefully the ac will be working for you if you need it. I hope you have the option to use curtains/shades/blinds on every single window by the time you stay there. Please ask Debra if you can play with the adorable puppies outside if the weather is nice :)

(Go walk it all!) their animals were so fun and the drive to all the sights (which Debra has thoughtfully bindered all together) was perfect! We could go and explore the mountains and cities/towns and then come back to cozy comfort. Buy some groceries and cook on the stove or in the crockpot and enjoy camping 1965 style. Sit by a bonfire and look at the stars through the incredible trees. Go pet the goats/sheep (and maybe even some puppies if youâ€™re lucky!) Children are welcome here and will have a blast! We cannot wait to go back! -A, E, & E.

Kaitlyn is a professional and efficient host; and my family and I appreciate her and the entire team.

review_text: We had a lovely, relaxing weekend at The Little House at RRCOS! Check in was easy with the keypad and they were extremely responsive anytime we messaged. Unfortunately, the weather put a damper on our plans, but fortunately the Little House was the perfect place to cozy up for a weekend and watch the snow fall on the absolutely beautiful view from their backyard. The location is super easy to get to, and really convenient to get to Downtown Colorado Springs or Old Colorado City. One thing to note is that the bathroom is very small. While Josh and Wendy do note that in their listing, the pictures didnâ€™t quite do it justice for me. If you are a large person or have mobility issues, it may not be the right house for you, as there is very little room to maneuver and using the toilet might be a challenge. Otherwise, I would highly recommend if you are looking for a great place outside Colorado Springs, there is no way you would find a more peaceful spot!

Our stay at the Red Rocks Open Space Little House was perfect! The house is cozy, very clean, and artfully decorated. If youâ€™re not an outdoorsy person, you can view the red rocks and mountains from the living and dining areas. For us, the deck was the place to be! Amazing views of the red rocks and surrounding mountains, the ever changing weather, and so many birds! You hear them and see them often. Two of our favorites were the black-billed magpie and the Bullockâ€™s oriole. Both stunning birds that we donâ€™t have at our home on the east coast. In the evening, the fire table adds a magical element to moon and star gazing.
The house is located in a quiet neighborhood off Hwy 24. You can hear traffic noise but itâ€™s not super loud. We visited over Memorial Day so there were many more cars on the road. The Little House is minutes from quaint and eccentric Manitou Springs and minutes from Garden of the Gods and so many other CO Springs destinations.
Josh & Wendy are terrific. Many stars!
